data.title: Add prefix argument to Quickopen command (CTRL+P)
data.body:
Add an argument (prefix) to "workbench.action.quickOpen" command.
This way you can populate the content with predefined values ("task JS:", "view_", ...) to filter the result using different keybinding.

I think the quickOpenService.show() method has already a prefix argument, so all we need to do is add it to the registered command.

data.title: Disable icons in VS Code - Ubuntu 16.04
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Add "workbench.editor.showIcons": false, in settings.json
2.  Reload window

It should: not show the icons
Result: Icons are still showing

data.title: hardware acceleration should be configurable in settings
data.body:
Due to the multiple ways of starting code, (UI, context menu, terminal) it is not always easy to specify the --disable-gpu option.

This option should be configurable in the settings file, so it acts gloabaly.

data.title: Code font in "Find References" does not work for me
data.body:
I see we now use the editor font in the "Find References" tree:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/27077268-c26c5856-502f-11e7-93a9-02a8573d19cf.png)

First of all, if we start to use this we should also use it in the search results view to be consistent (the results already look very similar). 

I suggest to have a setting for this though, I prefer the workbench font for search results in lists like that.

//cc @Microsoft/vscode for more UX input

data.title: [Selection - Output Panel] Selection extended to the current opened file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: insiders bbcd10...
- OS Version: Window 10 (insiders)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new file
2. Open the bottom panel and select some text inside the terminal or output panel
3. While maintaining left mouse button down, move the cursor on the left, over the sidebar

What happens?
Some text is selected in the currently opened file, above the output panel

What should happen?
Selection shouldn't extend to the opened editor

![vscode_selection](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/199648/27077207-90f8b0da-502f-11e7-9c53-d9dd361ade93.gif)

data.title: [build-windows] Error running scripts\code.bat
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: insider 24c9b09925...
- OS Version: Windows 10 (64bit)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run `scripts\npm.bat install` then `npm run watch`  
2. Run .\scripts\code.bat

What happens?
A new electron window is opened but vscode doesn't properly run and outputs errors:

```

    at Module.require (module.js:498:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)

    at Object.exports.onDidChangeKeyboardLayout (E:\Docs\Dev\vscode\node_modules\native-keymap\index.js:61:18)

[14816:0613/114719.748:INFO:CONSOLE(201)] "Loading "gc-signals" failed", source: file:///E:/Docs/Dev/vscode/out/vs/loader.js (201)
```

More errors follow.

data.title: Staged selected ranges still appear in the unstaged file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.15063]

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Here is the starting phase. 1 staged file and 1 unstaged. I will be staging some lines from the unstaged file which is `ai-chart-resize.directive.js`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337229/27076138-dff3e50e-505e-11e7-9d5b-3f19f914363b.png)

2. Here I select lines `50 - 67` of `ai-chart-resize.directive.js` and press `Stage Selected Ranges`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337229/27076176-f7a9c146-505e-11e7-8644-7451ff962c95.png)

3. `ai-chart-resize.directive.js` has been added to `Staged Changes` as expected`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337229/27076224-2bb7d220-505f-11e7-8a05-bc0c89aebf70.png)

4. As you can see the changes in line `50 - 67` has been staged.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337229/27076249-464df0f6-505f-11e7-95b5-7d84a76d1459.png)

5. Now, the problem starts here. Going back to the `Unstaged Changes` version of the file the lines `50 - 67` which I previously staged is still there.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337229/27076308-6a689090-505f-11e7-8f64-95aab9825f0d.png)

**Expected behavior**
Before, the expected behavior is that the lines staged will no longer appear in the `Unstaged Changes` version of the file since the lines are already staged.

There seems to be an issue with features related to `changes`.  So far, below is the only related:
#28326 Discard changes not working properly

data.title: Type casting autocompletes as HTML tag in TS
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.14
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create TS file with any variable that needs to be casted, e.g. to `string`
2. Type `<string`, then `>`, after `>` is typed, it autocompletes as `<string></string>` tag.

I believe this is very surprising that we have HTML tags autocomplete in TS files.

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.10

Is there any way gives me about binary file info instead of “The file will not be displayed in the editor because it is either binary, very large or uses an unsupported test encoding.” ?

Just gives me something about the file stat infomation and so on. I think it is very nice.

Hope to see it on v1.14.

data.title: Possible dispute between the renderer process and the main process on new version installation "hot reload"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Lubuntu 16.04

Installed the new version in the background while working on the previous one (1.12).
Once the installation finished, reloaded the window (`ctrl` + `shift` + `p` => "reload window").
Apparently this caused some weird behavior where the "about" menu item shows v1.12, the release notes show v1.13 and tons of things didn't work (no debug, no integrated terminal, no go-to-definition, no multicursor).

After mentioning it in another [issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28324), I was [told](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28324#issuecomment-307705083) by @alexandrudima:

> Your problem stemmed I think from our multi-process architecture. When reloading a window, only the 
renderer process + extension host of that renderer process gets reload, while the main process survives. I think you've run into the case where the main process was running at version N and the renderer process was running at version N+1. That is something perhaps @bpasero  or @joaomoreno would want to hear about such that we can quit or give a good error message instead of running in this inconsistent state.

Eventually, completely closing the running vscode and reopen it (not via "reload window") fixed everything.

data.title: tasks 2.0 incorrectly handles relative paths

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:43:13.058Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. package.json has following in "scripts" section: `"compile": "./node_modules/.bin/tsc -watch -p ./",`
2. tasks.json:
```
{
    "version": "2.0.0"
}
```
3. Run "build" task (Shift+Ctrl+B), I have output in the terminal:
```
node_modules\.bin\tsc.cmd : The module 'node_modules' could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module node_modules'.
At line:1 char:1
+ node_modules\.bin\tsc.cmd -p l:\vscode-cmake-tools\tsconfig.json
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (node_modules\.bin\tsc.cmd:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CouldNotAutoLoadModule
```

I suspect that for powershell relative path should be prepended with **./**

data.title: Selecting, copying and pasting causes editor to freeze
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-1496940180
- OS Version: Ubuntu Linux 4.4.0-79-generic

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select some code (JS file)
2. Hit CTRL-C or CTRL-X to copy/cut and paste

Sometimes without even reaching 2 the UI will freeze and after some seconds a popup will request to re-open, close, wait VSCODE.

I'm attaching a CPU profile while reproducing this.

[CPU-20170613T101713.cpuprofile.gz](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1070792/CPU-20170613T101713.cpuprofile.gz)

data.title: Is code fighting with npm?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:43:13.058Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.4.2|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.12|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.3.2|
|vscode-sort-json|richie5um2|1.9.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In a node project, open up the terminal in Code.
2. Perform an `npm install`
3. Experience some variant of `npm ERR! Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, rename `

Close code, perform the operation in powershell / cmd.  Operation succeeds.

I've only just started experiencing this in the last week or so and it's not consistent.  Sometimes installs succeed.  But I've experienced it on 2 separate computers, both running code and wondered if that could be the common factor...

data.title: Fat icons on Mac with Insiders
data.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1152805/27070164-1104540e-5018-11e7-8747-e9e34e4b55da.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1152805/27070181-27669644-5018-11e7-842f-1639b1868c4c.png)

- VSCode Version: 1.14.0.-insider
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start VS Code (Insiders)

I think I have this problem for about a month in 95% of all cases when I start VS Code Insiders (updated regularly).
